definition: Scout (youth organization)/see also 童子軍|童子军[Tong2 zi3 jun1]

sentences.english: What is the percentage of scouts to the total members of the four uniform teams?
sentences.chinese: 童军的人数占这四个制服团体总人数的几分之几？

sentences.english: I never lead anybody not at Brownies, not at Camp Fire Girls Queen Clarisse.
sentences.chinese: 我从未领导过任何人连兔子跟女童军都没有。

sentences.english: Scout Association of Hong Kong reserves the absolute right to alter the price without prior notice.
sentences.chinese: 香港童军总会保留修改价目之权利而毋须事前通知。

sentences.english: It is recommended that each national Scout Organization appoint a national coordinator for JOTI.
sentences.chinese: 建议各国童军总会指派一人负责协调JOTI活动。

sentences.english: Scout's honour is to be trusted.
sentences.chinese: 童军的荣誉是可信赖的。

sentences.english: His answer is cadet reporter and this year totally give up scout?
sentences.chinese: 他的答案是学记。今年完全放弃童军？

sentences.english: I hereby approve the applicant for The Venture Scout Award.
sentences.chinese: 兹批准申请人获深资童军奖章。

sentences.english: Girl Scout's honor is to be trusted.
sentences.chinese: 女童军的荣誉是受人信赖的。

sentences.english: Scout's duty is to be useful and to help others.
sentences.chinese: 童军的职责是准备自己去帮助他人。

sentences.english: I hereby recommend the applicant for The Venture Scout Award.
sentences.chinese: 兹推荐申请人获取深资童军奖章。

sentences.english: Next, scout out the rocks that you already have in your garden, if any.
sentences.chinese: 接下来，童军出石头，你已经在你花园如有。

sentences.english: Day camp Cub Scouts practiced to play the Chinese cymbals and drum.
sentences.chinese: 日营幼童军练习演奏中式钹及锣鼓。

definition: military sports/military fitness (curriculum etc)/abbr. for 軍事體育|军事体育
military practice, esp. for reservists or new recruits/military training as a (sometimes compulsory) subject in schools and colleges/drill
military sports/military fitness (curriculum etc)/abbr. to 軍體|军体
